isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO SERIES - ASSEMBLE - OUTPUT SHAFT ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: OUTPUT SHAFT ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Make sure the magnetic plugs are installed in the auxiliary housing.
When heating the bearings, do not heat bearings above 275°F (136°C).
When installing the rear bearing race, the proper depth is when the race shoulder is seated on bearing bore top.
Because the collar becomes distorted when compressed, do not use old nylon collar on rear bearing cover.

step1.para: Use toolmaker's dye and mark the LO range gear for timing purposes ( Figure 165).
Mark any two (2) adjacent teeth on the LO range gear. Repeat the procedure for the two (2) adjacent teeth directly opposite the first set marked.
With splined washer facing up, place the washer on the output shaft shoulder ( Figure 166).

figure.caption: Figure 166. Washer On Output Shaft Shoulder

step1.para: With LO range gear clutching teeth down, position LO range gear on the output shaft and engage the washer splines ( Figure 167).

figure.caption: Figure 167. LO Range Gear On Output Shaft

step1.para: With chamfer side up, position the LO range gear rear washer on the output shaft against the LO range gear ( Figure 168).

figure.caption: Figure 168. Rear Washer On Output Shaft

step1.para: With tapered side up, use heat or appropriate driver and install the output shaft front rear bearing ( Figure 169).

figure.caption: Figure 169. Install Output Shaft Front Rear Bearing

step1.para: Position the bearing inner spacer on the output shaft ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Bearing Inner Spacer On Output Shaft

step1.para: Lay the auxiliary housing front face up on a clean flat surface ( Figure 171). Install the front bearing cup.
Turn the auxiliary housing over, and install the rear bearing spacer and rear bearing race in the bearing bore ( Figure 172).

figure.caption: Figure 172. Rear Bearing Race In Bearing Bore

step1.para: With the auxiliary housing rear up, set the housing over the output shaft ( Figure 173).
Use a suitable driver to install the output shaft rear bearing with tapered side down ( Figure 173).

figure.caption: Figure 174. Align Gasket & Case Oil Return Holes

step1.para: Install the oil seal in the rear bearing cover.
Position the rear bearing cover over the new gasket ( Figure 175).

figure.caption: Figure 175. Apply Sealant To Retaining Bolts

step1.para: Apply Eaton/Fuller Sealant #71205 or Loctite 242 to the retaining bolts ( Figure 175).
Install the five (5) retaining bolts in the nonchamfered hole and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m) of torque.
Install the nylon collar and brass washer in the chamfered hole and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m) of torque.
